title: Brexit: EU sets out plans in case trade talks with UK fail
description: The EU's contingency plans for "no deal" include measures to ensure smooth air and road travel.

title: Britons could be barred from EU entry on 1 January
description: EU pandemic rules and Brexit may restrict travellers from entering the European Union.

title: Shropshire hospital 'blamed' mothers for babies' deaths
description: A large number of women also died in labour, a review into a scandal-hit maternity unit finds.

title: Covid: NHS long waits 100 times higher than before
description: Nearly 163,000 people had been waiting over a year at the end of October, compared with 1,600 in February.

title: England to play day-night Test as India tour confirmed
description: England will tour India early next year and play their first day-night Test in the country at the biggest cricket ground in the world.

title: UK growth slows again in October as rebound stalls
description: The UK's economy grew by just 0.4% in the month as the recovery continued to slow.

title: Italy World Cup legend Rossi dies, aged 64
description: Italy's 1982 World Cup hero Paolo Rossi, who finished top scorer at the tournament and got the opening goal in the final, has died aged 64.

title: Why 'preppers' are going mainstream
description: Why "preppers" are going mainstream and are no longer lonely survivalists on the fringes of society.

title: Brexit: 'Large gaps' remain after trade talks with Ursula von der Leyen
description: Sunday becomes the new deadline for a decision on trade talks, after the PM and EU chief meet in Brussels.

title: Thirty two men charged with sex abuse of eight girls
description: The abuse is alleged to have happened in Kirklees, Bradford and Wakefield between 1999 and 2012.

title: Townsend to lead Scotland at 2023 World Cup after deal extension
description: Head coach Gregor Townsend is "honoured and privileged" to sign a two-year contract extension that will see him lead Scotland at the 2023 World Cup.

title: Vulnerable teen given tent to live in, watchdog report finds
description: A report reveals a litany of damaging and unlawful decisions made about children in care.

title: What is GDP and how is it measured?
description: A basic guide to how the economy is measured and what that calculation is used for.

title: Boxing Day: Pressure mounts on supermarkets to close
description: Asda is to close on Boxing Day, and unions repeat calls for other major chains to follow suit.

title: 'I was told my kid was a distraction' - what's it like becoming a mother while playing?
description: With Fifa expected to approve new maternity cover regulations this month, what is it like to be a mother playing professional football?

title: Karen Carney column: Olivier Giroud is a dream for a manager
description: In her latest BBC Sport column, Karen Carney discusses the impact of Olivier Giroud, his place in the Chelsea squad and why he is undervalued.

title: Cyberpunk 2077: The story behind the video game
description: The creators of the highly anticipated title reveal their inspirations.

title: Tao Geoghegan Hart: The 'overnight sensation' 10 years in the making
description: The story behind Britain's fifth Grand Tour winner is "the stuff of comic books". Here's how Tao Geoghegan Hart rose to success.

title: Advent calendar: Day 10 - the double-amputee snowboarder proving doubters wrong
description: Day 10 of BBC Sport's 2020 advent calendar features Darren 'Swifty' Swift, a double-amputee snowboarder competing at the British Snowboard and Freeski Championships.

title: Asian honeybees 'defend hives from hornets with faeces'
description: The finding is thought to be the first to document the use of tools by Asian honeybees.

title: US Covid vaccine: Three key questions answered
description: How will Americans receive the vaccine? Will it be free? And will enough people take it?

title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: How a soldier survived an 11-hour gun battle
description: Ethiopian soldiers recount the dramatic moment their army camps were raided in Tigray.

description: Four Syrians say they enlisted for sentry duties in Azerbaijan and were sent to the Nagorno-Karabakh front line.

title: Covid: Students and retirees form long-distance friendships
description: The pandemic inspires a scheme to pair language students with older people in France via video link.

title: Covid-19: The mask-wearing US city that bucked the trend
description: Compulsory mask-wearing has been highly controversial in the US.

title: How Slumdog composer is giving Indian talent a helping hand

title: Losing my dad: 'Everything looks the same but it isn't'

title: Climate change: Have countries kept their promises?

title: Greater Manchester Police 'failed to record 80,000 crimes in a year'

title: Humpback whale snapped during New York City harbour visit

title: Covid-19: How everyday life has changed in Wuhan
description: While the rest of the world is battling a second wave of infections Wuhan hasn’t had any locally transmitted cases for months.

title: West End actors performing on your doorstep
description: Professional actors can be booked to perform on doorsteps across the UK.

title: Black hair code launched to tackle racial discrimination
description: Campaigners have created a black hair code to try and end discrimination in schools and workplaces.
